name: Campingplatz Leibnitz
description: Busy terrain under trees or in the open on a footballfield (?)

name: Waldcamping St.Gallenkirch
description: Nice campground with lots of trees, new facilities, clean, outside of the village but close to the ski area (800m), bus next to the campground, restaurant 400m, Aquarena  900m, 20 - 25 Euros for 2

name: Bielerhöhe
description: Gravel parking lot on top of the Silvretta Hochalpenstrasse  (Bielerhöhe) close to a reservoir (Silvretta Stausee), free, toilets 200m next to the reservoir (open 24h),  fountain with fresh drinkable water 200m next to the chapel, restaurants nearby, many hiking trails, nice mountain view

name: Parking For Glacier
description: This is the parking lot for campers and buses for the glacier. There is a free shuttle that takes you to the top. The road toll cost 34 euro to get up here. We asked the parking attendant and he said it is a grey area but you can generally sleep here for a night and not be bothered. The night we stayed there were 15 other rigs. There are tons of campers and traffic during the day but quiets down at night. Beautiful view to wake up to.

name: Oetztal Arena Camping
description: Campground 2 kilometers from Stuibenfall waterfall, largest in Tirol. http://www.tyrol.com/things-to-do/attractions/all-attractions/a-stuibenfall-oetztal.   Plenty of hiking trails, good Tirol food 10 min walk away. Breathtaking views. Showers are 6min per 50 euro cents. Great hosts. Mountaineering nearby.

name: Attersee
description: It's a lake site green area with enough space to park your van! You have to pay from 10am to 4pm and there is a maximum parking time of 3h. Outside this hours it's free to stay...

name: Hitler was born in this town
description: Beautiful small Austrian town. though Hitler was born here, you wouldn't know it.  free wifi in the city

name: Innsbruck side road
description: after 7 pm the area is free to park till 9 am. at this location is a small street with limited drive by traffic at night. very quiet. though there is a train running on the other side of fence you do not really hear it and won't keep you up unless you are a really light sleeper. this is a side road. left windows open, no bugs.

name: podersdord am see camping
description: Big euro-industrial style camping spot on the lake. Best option for kitesurfing but expensive crowded and loud as far as camping goes, at least in high season. If wind is your thing then grin and bear it, otherwise anywhere else would be better...

name: Aschbach-Markt, Auckental
description: Campsite in farm yard. Voluntary fee. One bathroom with toilet and shower, only warm when sunny. Beatiful site: grass, flowers, fruit trees. Close to highway, but very peaceful.

name: Salzmann Camping
description: Nice campground directly at Bodensee (Lake Constance) and nature reserve Rheindelta, beach only 100 m away. Canoe rental. Very friendly host. Fast mobile internet (Austrian and German net). Overcrowded in July/August. 40 EUR for 1 vehicle, 2 persons pn w/o electricity.

name: Seecamping Müller, Weissensee
description: Nice campground. If you arrive outside the opening hours of reception, just get yourself a spot and tell them later (the next day). Nice for swimming (access to lake in camping), hiking, biking. Not enough showers. Kiosk with bread and coffee. EUR 29 for 2 incl. electricity., EUR 26 without.

name: Wien Suite Hotel 200 M Sim Prater
description:
Hotel appart, friendly and helpful, great breakfast price for two 50 € large room
, Kitchenette, only 15 minutes walk from the center is recommended

Hotel appart , accueil sympa et serviable , super petit déjeuner prix pour deux  50€ grande  chambre , kitchenette, à seulement 15 mn a pied du centre on recommande

name: Parking Hütteldorf
description: A parking outside of Wien, but there is the U4 station to go into the city center! Great to visit Wien and have a quiet night!

name: Ybbs
description: stahlroth: car park directly at Danube river, good for overnight stop.

name: 4x4service.at LAND ROVER SPECIALIST
description:
LAND ROVER SPECIALIST: 
PETER SCHUSTER
Kfz-Servicestation
Gewerbepark 3 / 2732 Willendorf
Tel.Nr.: +43 680 311 51 31

name: Deutsch Jahrndof
description: Beautiful place on grass with trees for shade. Donation payment for the water and emptying sewerage. In a back street of the little town.

name: Schluga Camping
description: It looks like an expensive camping place. They also have apartment buildings. Nice, quiet location surrounded by the Alps.

name: Berggruss Camping
description: Small, friendly and inexpensive camping. Very nice location. They even have a small swimming pool. I've just drove by and stopped but talked to some campers and they highly recommend it!

name: Erich Christ
description: Specialist for 4x4 vehicles, especially Iveco and Bremach.

name: Private parking place next to the Drau river
description: We were looking for a place to raft on the river and ran into this place. They let us stay for the night at the parking place and we used the facilities (bar, toilet and hot shower) of the rafting company (Cool's). It's close to a big road, but because the river is fast flowing you only heard the river. Btw: the rafting was really nice, we had lots of rain, so made the best of all this water. If you consider rafting, go for the 'rock 'n roll' track.

name: Camping Plorz
description:
Nice campground with Access to the lake.
the child-friendly site lies amid an idyllic landscape directly by the shore of the lake Ossiacher See. The site offers its own beach with a large lawn for both sunbathing and playing. In spring and autumn fishing is very popular. Your four-legged darlings are welcome as well, there is enough space for all. At the accompanied inn or the sunny terrace overlooking the lake you can enjoy Carinthia´s hospitality, rooms are also available.

name: Forest & River
description:
Nice parking near a River.
Lot of trail starts at this place.

name: Silbersee Camping
description:
It's a small and simple Campingground at the lake called Silbersee. Unfortunately we don't found the treasure in the lake ✌️😁

Without electricity it cost 8€ per night, with electricity 11€ (connection behind the hedge). No matter how many persons you are. 

There is also a Toilette with a simple shower (as you can see at the picture)a little bit far away. To the lake its only 50m and perfect for swimming. 

If the weather is good you also can by something to eat (Silberseeburger!) and drinks at the kiosk. 

And don't worry about the company on the other side of the river. They will switch off there machines during afternoon and night.

name: Baggerseen
description:
Dredging lake, all fenced and private, yet possible to take a bath early in the morning unobserved ...
--
Baggersee, alles abgezäunt und privat, dennoch möglich früh morgens unbeobachtet ein Bad zu nehmen...

name: Hilltop View
description: Parking Space on top of a hill with fancy view over the river Dunabe, Bratislava and to an Austrian castle. In the night sometimes drunken youngsters with cars.

name: Holzplatz
description: Small place used to be an area woodwork and lumbering. As good hidden from the street as possible. The path from the street to the place  is little steep.

name: Zollamt Schaanwald-Tisis
description: Customs for all cars and trucks. Please be aware that you will, coming from Austria (EU) you will be controlled by Swiss customs (Switzerland is not in the EU).

name: Namlospass
description: little Parking lot on the trail, not to close on the street, perfect for one night

name: Camping Fernsteinsee
description:
Two very nice and crystal clear lakes nearby Fernsteinsee and Sameranger
you need to stay at least two nights to get a diving permit ... it is realy awesome

name: Camping Zeinissee
description: What a amazing place. Vieuw over the beautiful lake. Nice hike and bike tracks around. Campsite is at 1800m. 25 pitches. Frendly owners. Clean bathroom. You have to pay for WiFi. Veloco-cycling.

name: Pipi & Frank's garden stay
description:
We, a group of three, took some day off in the panonian lowlands of Austria and had the luck to get to know Pipi, Frank and their traveller sons Christopher and Philip. The family owns a typical, but modern house of this area with a garden and enough space to set up your tent or park your car. The house is yellow and has the number 15, if you just pass by and need some Wi-Fi or a toilet, you will for sure get offered some fresh coffee or a cold beer! Mostly they are busy during the day, but try your luck and ring the bell!

This place be available for future travelers as well: they were happy to be part of the app.

name: Pleifers Engel
description:
Nice Restaurant, with delicious food and friendly staff.
Everything you get here is produced by local farmers.
Also good for Vegetarian / Vegan People

name: Soccerclub Riegersburg
description:
Mixparking next to a soccer field. 
Close by small village with some restaurants.
No further facilities.

name: Krimmler Waterfalls
description: Supposed to be the heighest waterfalls in Europe. Turn left before the ticket Office to the "Alter Taunerweg" for free access to the upper level

name: Parking of the Schwimmbad
description: Next to the Schwimmbad. Any kind of vehicle. You should eat a PIZZA at Sandro’s. 200 Meter before this place. The owner is very kind and the Pizzas are great and cheap.

name: St. Stefan im Rosental
description: Free Parking Spot to place your van/mobilehome. Possibility to use electricity or water against a fee (you throw in coins into a power/water supply). Pub/restaurant nearby and lots of little shops in the village. Quiet area.

name: Toll free road to Hungary
description: Parking pull-off with views and garbage bins. Not a busy road and only a distant neighbour, phone gets h+ at times but the sunset is superb over the far hills.

name: the border from austria to hungary
description: We were waived thru in our 5.5 ton motorhome and no checks or pp control on the austrian side. Also no-one to be seen on the hungary side so we stopped at the convenient store/gas station where a friendly german speaking lady issued a vignett receipt and took 5950 hl. on the debit card for 10 days. We won't need 10 days but the 24 euro maut is expensive but its less hassle than trying to find toll free roads as our maps.me doesnt do " no toll roads". The first toll cameras are just as you start driving on the 8 road.

name: Camping Car Parking
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Location updated.
----
Paid parking spot for camping cars near Hallstatt.
Next to the lake so good for a swim in the morning :).

There's a public toilet on the parking lot.

No tents allowed.

name: 1. Reisemobil-Stellplatz Wien
description: Not a campground but a camperstop with all the facilities you need. Handy for an overnight if you travel trough. Access to the metro if you want to visit Vienna. Open 24/7, just get yourself a spot and pay the next morning. EUR 19 without power. Good shower. You can order bread for the next day.

name: Camping Ferien am Walde
description:
The campsite is quite large. Lots of high trees giving plenty of shade. The owner is very nice and this site doesn't get as crowded as the other camps surrounding Faaker See. So it's easy to get a space even if you don't have a reservation. 
There's a kiosk selling bread in the morning and drinks etc. throughout the day. 

It's a 15-20 minutes walk to the lake and you'll have access to it through Camping Anderwald.

name: Brand Wild Camp
description: End of a forest road there is a beautiful spot to camp, well hidden in the forest but with views of the alps. Cross over the river with the small church (with the bench outside) on your right. Take the first right onto a dirt road, then first hairpin left turn, at the end of this road is the spot.

name: Grossbruck
description: Nice open meadow right at the river. However the road is very close and noisy.

name: Camping Poysdorf
description: Nice, small Campsite, with Clean facilities. Can only recommend. The price was somewhere around 10-12€ for 1 person, tent and motorcycle

name: Tandels Au
description: Free possibility to be free. Fenced grounds on pasture with Dixi and fantastic views. One is awakened by neighboring cows. Fire is allowed in a solid hearth.

name: camp next obergurgl
description: Easy access on a gravel road just off the road but quiet. Noise from the river only.

name: Stellplatz am Erlebnisbad
description:
A not expensive place to park a campervan for a night,  7€ for two. 
Toilets and showers are available. Town near by.

name: Gosauschmied Hotel
description: Next to the Hotel you can park the Camper If you drink something in the Restaurant! Very friendly Lady!

name: Stadium parking
description: Parking for the stadium very quiet at night

name: Oliver kocht
description: A site for campers directly at a good restaurant. Realy nice for one night on the way south or north. Green grasy field. Little noise because of the street near by but realy quiet at night. Costs are 15 Euro per car. Free and fast Wi-Fi.

name: camping Hohe Wand
description: little campground with mountain view. good as a base for climbing, para gliding and hiking. note that shower is inside the green ti-pi

name: Between Ducks
description: Small Halfisland in a duck lake near the Tauernradweg. You can hide your tent between some trees. Some pedestrians during the day. Noise from the trains next to the lake. In the evening there are strong lights behind the railway from a tennis ground. But they are shut off at about 9 pm.

name: Parking next to river
description: Small place off the road under the bridge. Right next to the river with beautiful views of forests and mountains. We stayed overnight and had no problems.

name: Camping Nachbagauer
description: Nice open field behind the farmhouse. Quiet place on the other side of the river. Friendly people. Clean sanitary.

name: Camp spot in the mountains
description: Lonely wild camping spot by the toll free street. However only lonely in the summer due to the winter sport off season.

name: Hartberg
description: Very quiet and relaxed camping. Ring the bell for the gate, and pay at the nearby swimming pool.

name: Grassy field by old bridge and abandoned house
description: Big field od grass at the bottom of valley. There is a gravel road which leads to old and abandoned house. Mountains around and view to big, old and stunning railway bridge. Water can be obtained from river. Bad network (Internet) coverage.

name: Gramartboden parking lot
description:
Parking lot next to Gramartboden grill area / playground. Might be crowded at weekends.  At the morning plenty of dog lovers. But generally this is a quiet place next to Innsbruck city. Water source next to the parking.

Road from the north is accessible. Road from the south is narrow, steep and last 600m has no-entry signs but still possible to cross and mostly shorter. We passed it few times, nobody cared. Keep in mind that on Sunday and other holidays the road is closed and police check the parking and gives tickets (check out Google Maps place to find more).

name: Parking area with toilet and water
description: A nice place to park on a quiet dead end road. There is a clean toilet (please keep clean) and water and sink. There is a restaurant if you continue up the road. Weak mobile signal.

name: Camping next to abandoned train station
description: Nice place for a night next to an abandoned train station. We were there in winter and the toilets there were locked and the taps turned off, but I imagine in summer it all works. Nice little village.

name: Views of the Millstatter See
description: Informal spot with amazing views on the lake and mountains. Very quiet, it seems like no one uses this route except for a few runners before sunset.

name: 1. REISEMOBIL-Stellplatz Salzburg
description: More then 100 tight spots next to each other. Perfect for one or two nights to visit Salzburg. There is a bus from here to city centre. The place is 20 Euro per night, excl. electricity (not sure how much, we didn't use). WIFI is 2 Euro extra but really good 4G signal. Very clean toilets and showers. Portable water available. Also washing mashine and dryer (1 Euro per 30 minutes), open 24/7

name: Reisemobilstellplatz Mureck
description: Campground not far from the border to Slovenia. Small spots, more for overnight stay then for making holidays. But very clean toilets and showers, laundry (extra about 50 cents per 30 minutes) and dishes facilities. 19 Euro per night, 2 Euro extra for electricity, also tents and caravans allowed. In summer free entrance to the swimming pool next door. Wifi also extra 2 Euro per 24 hours.

name: Schacherwald
description: ild campsite at the woods edge, remote and beautiful

name: Lot by the lake
description: Dirt area, looks like parking lot.  very quiet.

name: Neue Donau (Camping Wien)
description:
Good location for camping near Vienna. Facilities are reasonably good, especially for price. paid €16 for car with rooftop tent. 10minute walk to train station. Next to Fuel Station. 
Surrounded by highway on one side and railway line on other but I didn't find it a problem. What was a let down is there is no WIFI. They say there is but it doesn't work. 
Generally to be close to Vienna, its good.

name: Free shower at AP Station
description: Clean bathroom and free shower in 1 floor. Gasoline ist cheaper  than other places. sometimes you have to show your ID card to the cashier for shower .

name: camping wienerwald
description: Great little camp ground set in forested/small village area. Great if one wants to be out of the city. We paid €20 for an evening with electricity.

name: Sunnseitn guest house
description: A friendly guest house with a fully equipped self catering apartment in a magnificent mountain world with an attached beekeeping. Separate entrance, own bathroom, private parking, outdoor pool. No camping. One night (2 p) 70 € and a glass of honey for free.

name: Parking Lot next to Camping Arlberg
description:
[ADMIN]
Note that wild camping is illegal in Austria.

Big parking lot next to the camping and soccer place. River access. Nice spot for one night.

name: Campinplatz Sulmsee
description:
Campground around a small lake. A lot of space, no marked spaces. The road next to the lake is audible but very faint. You can stay on grass next to trees. Toiletts and showers were pretty clean. No supermarket on site, but in the main season a baker van will come in the morning. Good swimming, you can rent SUPs. No entry barrier so you can also come at night. Electricity present. Fee was around 23 euro for two persons and a camper.

Very nice for an overnight stay! On the other side of the lake there is a winery. You can get „Heuriger“ or wine there.

name: Nice Place in france
description: Near the River, Grass spot ! The Place is for hunters but we had mi Problem

name: Camping Vienna west
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Money was stolen out of campers car. Exercise caution.

Camping Ground for mainly mobil campers..
Good shower toilet wash facilities. Easy to reach town by public transport..
One car 2 adult two kids 44 euros/night
( attention..money was stolen from our car during night > found empty bag under car)

name: Camping Grubner
description: Big campground, borders direktly to lake Faaker see. Big trees around, so well shaded places. New, modern, clean Toillets, showers etc. New modern styled restaurant. Offers good food to fair prices. Small shop with bakeries. Direct access to lake.

name: Quiet Street parking
description: dead end street. 20 min walk to old town. free Mon-Fri 1900 to 0900, all day Sat and Sun.

name: Bad Neubreenan campground
description: nice clean campground, full services, friendly reception. beside a small lake. €22 for 2A w power.

name: Camping Freizeitsee Zenz
description: Nice spot close to Grünersee. For campers and tents.

name: Parking lot of the local lake beach
description: I haven't tried it out myself as we live close by. But this parking lot is free of charge and there's some campers always around. This place is more remote and less crowded than other places around lake Neusiedl. The small beach is in 2 minutes walking distance. And in Jois there is a lot of "Heurigen". Local vineyards servin delicious local food and wine. Recommendation!

name: Landgasthof Parking Lot
description: Parking lot connected to a very cool guesthouse and restaurant called Landgasthof Ropferstubm & Ropferhof. We asked if it was ok to stay for the night and they are friendly to campers, we even got a special parking sticker for our van. Parking was free, toilet available at the restaurant of course, but no other amenities. Restaurant is great, nice views, very quiet and out of the way. It is just a parking lot, so do not expect to put out the awning, table, chairs, etc. but it is a nice stop over on the way to some great hiking around Seefeld the day after :) If you need to go to the toilet in the wild during the night, be mindful and respectful - the owners have had some bad experience in the past and were a bit sensitive to let us stay there (we have no chemical toilet).

name: Schön am Fluss
description: Cozy place by the river, Perfect for one night.

name: Quite parking lot
description: Nice and quiet parking lot off a road with close to zero traffic during the night. Good stop for a sleep over and just a 5 min. drive from the starting point of the hiking trails up Hohe Munde. Mind that the parking lot seems to be popular as a starting point for cyclists, so the parking lot (free during the day too) will start filling with cars at some point in the morning.

name: Alpencamping Raggaschluft
description: Small family owned campsite with a restaurant. Paid €22 for 2 pers and car+rooftoptent. Facilities are nice and clean. Big covered place with benches. Near to the raggacanyon.

name: Mountain hill Solden - Hoch Solden
description:
Large ground to stay with a wonderfull view over Sölden valley. Quit and beautiful. 
Not accessable for the big wite motorhes because the dirt road is pretty steep. 
If you park close to the side you are invisseble from the road. 


Take the road to HochSolden. Between turn 2 and 3 there is a small dirt road at the right hand side going down.

name: Gasthof Theresienhof
description:
Cheap 30€ for a single room with shared bathroom.
However, DON'T go here because you want to Spend a nice night. It is only a solution if you totally need a place to sleep here. it is rather dirty, old and loud, Not recommended.

name: L 197 /Langen am Arlberg
description: Near railay, near small river, open ground for parking, no service, hiking trails crossig/starting here

name: Ginsing hiker and climber campsite
description:
€15 to stay overnight. €5 for daytime parking. 
Toilet facilities (no showers), no official drinking water although can take water from major river alongside and it is very clear.

name: Wanderparkplatz Pölsen
description: Big gravel parking some 100m off the main road. Few vehicles pass because it is also an access road for houses in the forest, otherwise very quiet. Small river with clean water 500m down the road.

name: Lohhütte
description: This is a great place to stay overnight with grill facilities. There is a play ground for children, grill facilities , wood at site, laydown easy chairs, and a log cabin. As we were here the log cabin was open. There is a fireplace in the inside and plenty of wood so you can cook/grill a meal. There is a toilet outside, however it is locked. This road is quite narrow, but transitable in any vehicle. There is almost no traffic and it is definitely worthwhile seeing. 2 km north of here there is water for cyclists on the left hand side of the road.

name: Camping Hirschegg
description: Very nice camping next to the small gasthouse own by same friendly and very helpful people. Spots for tents with cars/bikes as well as for campers. Very green area, small creek passing nearby. toilets, bbq places, hot showers (1€/3min). You can order breakfast for 8€. Nice place to stay for a while.

name: Gravel Quarry
description: This place is tucked away between river and road.

name: Oberfellach
description: Tiny informal camp on a hillside for 4 vehicles run by friendly people. A beauty spot,  overlooking a vast valley and facing high mountains.

name: Camping Mauterndorf
description:
Perfect campground in summer and winter, 365 days, all facilities: www.auszeit-xl.at
Near to cable car, skiing, hiking, cycling ... many benefits. Highly recommended.

name: fish pond
description: small area.  good in a pinch.  sleep under huge pine trees

name: River side
description: Nice place close to the river in the forest. Quite place

name: Roadside Wildcamp
description: Pretty hidden from the road, it has tap water, quiet at night. Ok if you arrive in the dark, I wasn't able to find a more remote spot.

name: Heiligenkreuz Carpark
description: Carpark next to „Stift Heiligenkreuz“. Just a Parking place with a small picknick area. It’s next to the Fire Fighters Station and the monestry. No facilities or others but quiet and only a few km away from the motorway.

name: In the woods
description: A not perfect place but nice for a night. It’s a bit steep clime to get on top of the last unplaced Hill. Follow the signs to ....see. (Lake) it’s very quite at night, and almost hidden from the road.

name: Katzenberg
description: In front of the water. Night very quiet.

name: Camping Via Claudiasee
description: Midsize campground run by a nice family next to the Swiss border. Directly next to Inn river which prevents to hear the road noise.

name: Camping an der Traun
description:
Small camp ground attached to a bed and breakfast
Only few spots. Next to the river Traun.

name: Aktiv Camping Imst
description: Old fashion camp ground, friendly owner. Bar and several common rooms are offered. Near to the city and next to the public swimming bath. Fair prices (24 Euro for two adults and a camper)

name: Ryan‘s private meadow parking
description: Fell free to stay here. Usually it’s a parking area for agriculture equipment but there is always free space. Next to the meadow is a river and round the corner you have a small supermarket. If you need water, WiFi, electricity, etc. ring at Altes Dorf 32, maybe I am at home! Nothing special - good for one night!

name: Weitenegg Parkinglot B3 (near Melk)
description: one of the rare parkinglots without 'No Camping' sign at a side arm of the Danube ; a little bit noisy from the street; ok for one night; Restaurant 'Gruber' nearby;

name: Hotel Vösenhuber / Bed & Breakfast
description:
Small Hotel with friendly owner. Rooms are clean and basic. In house restaurant is closed. At least motorbikes can be parked in a garage. Paid 35€ per night.

Restaurants and ATM in walking distance.

name: Wild Camping near Friesach
description:
Nice place at the left side of the road B 317 before Friesach. 
In the middle of the trees, 50 meters from the road. At night some trains pass by but is OK. Good place with no snow now in the winter. Fits small cars, campers and vans. Rooftent like our also.

name: Bike-friendly Host
description:
Hi!   My name is Mike and I love to ride bikes and go bike travelling.
As i love to stay anywhere at rooms or private gardens on my travels, i also want to offer this for my bike-travelling mates.
I offer a tent-site, and sanitary for free.   
If you travel with tents you can also have a stop here for a few days, enjoy nature, lake "Attersee" and find some energy for heading on...

Contact me via Email:  liftingerm@gmail.com or  Whatsapp: +43660/7393818

name: Camping Aufenfeld
description: If you want to live in luxery...this 5 star campsite has got everything. Even sites with gas connection. We saw several overlanders in winterseason. We payed in low season 30,00. Supermarkt, indoor pool, sauna etc. 3 km from ski area.

name: Camping Grimmingsicht
description:
Not large but very butyful.                                         


.

name: Riverside
description:
Stone - muddy track up to river, about 200m from highway.
A smaller river (flows under the main road) flows into the big River Enns. You can park when you get to the smaller river and walk over to get some nice evening spots. It's really quiet, the river is the loudest noise!

name: Camping Zechner
description: Camping Zechner 7,5€/Person+ 8€/car+ 2€ electricity, children & dogs for free, everything available without grey water

name: Lobau parking
description:
Lobau parking
National park parking area at the end of the road, next to a lake, restaurant and forest.
Quiet area, good for one night! No camping ban sign. On the right side at the entry of the parking area there is a way down to the lake.

name: Big Danube parking
description: Long parking area along the Danube. The first 2km are noisy then it’s very quiet. Toilets, shower and water are not available in winter.

name: Small Farm Camping
description: Camperplatz Fritzbauer Tel: 0043658272351, paid 15€ for 1car +2People +child&dog + electricity, it‘s allowed to empty grey water on dunghill

name: Official overnight parkinglot
description:
Near Hollenstein/Ybbs, official overnightparking. Place for 3 big cars, above a river, clean toilets, playground, very quiet
Shelter with tables nearby, small access to the cold river, old blacksmith (Hammerschiede) to visit 
5€ donation per day for the Parking
Nice and green surrounding in the mountains

name: water tap
description: water tap on the little place. free. easy to fill.

name: water and diesel
description: very cheap diesel and water tap free. easy to use

name: lippiz piber
description: if you want to see the show with the Spanish horses, it's very nice!

name: Calm Spot behind soccer ground
description: Easy to reach spot behind a soccer ground. Leave the Main road to the soccer ground. you can stay at the parking lot of the soccer team. we stayed behind in the nature. you can not see the place from the street. in the morning a cyclist passed but no problem at all.

name: Camping Riffler
description: We are hiking the E5 From Oberstdorf to Meran and we decided to take our camping gear too. I really do not recommend this because you can stay at huts along the way. In Landeck (Zams) we found a nice camping. It is not very quiet because it is near the street. It is easy to find though. For two persons with a small tent the fee was 25,4€. Electricity included.

name: Camping Sölden
description:
A fancy camping in the "bike republic Sölden". In summer it is a mountain bike paradise. The camping has a wellness area also which costs 5€ extra. For two backpackers for one night without anything fancy it is 38€. Although it is very clean and it offers a lot, I don't think I'll come back in te future.
Another thing that is worth mentioning is that there isn't a place reserved for tents. You put your tent on a regular place which fits better a camper wagon. There are a lot of stones and it is difficult to put the tent spikes.

name: Nice grassy spot by the river
description: Nice patch of grass by the river large enough for a few tents. Great view. Accessible from the bicycle track 100m back.

name: Karls Livingroom
description:
A narrow unpaved road that goes along the Drau river and offers several spots for parking ond setting up tents. Those spots were apparently used for fishing. Some locals used the road in the morning.

Caution: We had to pass under the bridge. Normal cars do fine, busses might not fit.

name: Woodland wild camp for cyclists
description: Nice area of woodland just off the cycle route, follow one of the dirt roads off the path and it'll lead into the woods. Well hidden, plenty of places to pitch a tent. There is quite a bit of car noise from the nearby roads but not enough to be a bother.

name: Hidden gravel area
description: Big flat gravel area under some very impressive cliffs and completely hidden from the road. There is a barrier so cars/vans won't be able to drive in, but there's space for a campervan to park just before the barrier and you'd still be out of the way. Plenty of space for many freestanding tents in the main area. A bit noisy as there is some kind of industry going on not far away but noone around and a really beautiful private spot for the night.

name: Walchhofer Bendlthomagut
description: nice clean big gasthof. also to book with kitchen. It is next to a big road. But very near to the town. Walking distance. nice big breakfast. clean!

name: Skilift Andelsbuch
description:
A part of the parking lot is reserved for “camping”. 
Set up your gear only in the designated spots because you will be sent away if doing otherwise. 

Camping is not allowed in the winter i think. In summer weekends it might be crowded with paragliders. 
The cost for the night are euro 5,-

name: Schloss Camping Aschach
description:
Nice campsite in Volders, Tirol with restaurant, swimming pool and about 160 pitches.
Hot showers and free wifi available almost everywhere on the campsite. Moderate pricing.

name: Parking Lot next to River
description:
Gravel parking lot just across the river next to Felbertauern Straße.
Fairly level. Not so quiet because of the road nearby. Okay for one night.

name: Parking Lot
description:
Parking Lot next to Gondola. Saw no signs, 5 Rigs staying here overnight.
Restaurants and town adjacent.
Toilet facilities at the Gondola nearby during daytime hours.

name: Parking Spot
description:
A parking spot usually used by joggers and hikers. Can also be used for a night. Unlimited drinking water and garbage bin available.

Moderator Note: Use of this Place for overnight parking has not been confirmed.

name: Lammerklamm
description: Public parking for the Lammerklamm. About 50-100 meters from the street.

name: Hochkönig
description: Small area beside the road. At the parking lot further up the street you have to pay 15€ for one night, here it costs nothing.

name: KFZ-Technik Oliver Walton
description: Does repairs for all kind of cars. We brought our Mitsubishi Delica to check the breaks/break pads and to rotate the wheels. He also fixed our door which was hanging a little bit. We could see that he had a lot to do but still he fit us in and did the work very well and in one day. We paid 50 €, which we think of a fair price. Great service, very friendly.

name: AP Petrol Station
description: Washing and drying machines, a.t.m. 8kg 4€, 18kg 8€, drying 18kg 2€. Lots of different stuff Here aswell, e.g. showers

name: Quite cemetery parking
description: Nice and quite parking in front of a cemetery. Perfect for vans and off road vehicles. Also for tents. Grass all around, trees and trash bin.

name: Woodland hideaway
description: 100m off the road in the forest above the valley. Views through the trees of the mountains. Hiking trails close by. Quiet once the road traffic stops in the evening. Good 4g reception too!

name: Camping am See
description: Lovely little campsite run by volunteers next to the A9. There are toilets, showers, electricity and water available. Next to it is a beautiful lake with an amazing view. Perfect for one or two nights. We paid 14,40€ for 2 people and a van. Someone comes in the evening to collect the money. If you arrive later, there is a box at the entrance (Please, pay to keep this place beautiful and clean).

name: In the woods
description: Short ride or drive down a dirt track to an opening where you can wild camp well out of the way. Good for one night.

name: Parking
description: Parking for lokal Cemetry. For one or two nights you won't get sued.

name: Wildcamp Silvretta-Bielerhöhe
description:
Beautifull Campspot next to the sea.
It's very quiet and the stars are wonderful at night. In the morning there came some hikers.
It's good for tents and for Cars, but not really for big campers.
At the Restaurant, around a half km to walk, are toiletts.
Take care because of cows!
I would give 5 stars, but the app dont work and i cant give stars.

name: Raststation St. Pölten
description: large truck stop with restrooms,  warm shower (50 ct/ 10 min!!), little picknick areas with roofs. Rosenberger restaurant and gas station right next to it. Nothing scenic, but clean and for free!

name: WWW.Wohnkabine.at
description:
Camper RV Service
Not a mechanic for the Car.
The Camping Cabin

name: Landy Man
description: Nice guy and helpful with all problems with Land Rovers. Oh and Jaguars and I saw a Fiat Panda. Restoration etc

name: Official parking lot
description: This is an official overnight parking lot for maximum 4 campers for one night.

name: Furtmühle
description: Nice quiet Place (Former Mill) directly on a small River. Place to swim.

name: Near Pfunds
description:
Just beside the Ins River. At the right side of the highway 180 heading north.
A small parallel gravel road You can find small places to stop and camp.
We did it with our SUV and rooftop tent.
Good for small cars or campers.

name: Ruhiger öffentlicher Parkplatz
description:
Is good for an overnight stay and has a bus connection to the city in about 2 minutes.

Ist für eine Übernachtung gut und hat in ca. 2 Gehminuten eine Busanbindung in Richtung Stadt

name: Gmuden Tourisme Office
description: A huge parking area with 10 places for vans. free wifi. water at  tourist office. building with toilets 0.50€. near lake and some restaurants. BBQ. Dumping.

name: Parkplatz Wildgerlostal
description: This is a rather large parking lot next to a small lake. You can park here overnight (5€ for cars and 10€ for camper vans). It’s super quiet, minus the cowbells (though we found that to be part of the charm). It’s a nice little spot :) It’s not clear if tents are technically allowed, but we had a tent next to our rig and it didn’t seem to be a problem. It’s also possible that slightly further up the road there could be a little restaurant, but at the time of this posting, we hadn’t gone further to look.

name: Lovely campground next to a swimming lake - Schachblumenwelt Großsteinbach
description: Great overlander-friendly place for a stop-over, even if just for lunch and a swim.

name: Lärchenhof
description: Not so nice place but you can get a shower for 2EUR if you travel through.

name: Camping Dornbirn
description:
Large green lawn pitches. Flat and easy to access. This is quite a large campsite. Not much shade but some sites do have.
The facilities are large well maintained.

name: Wild camp
description: Wild camp, near road. We can't find camp near This location. Its quiet place, near road. It’s good for motorcycles and cars. Brook is near.

name: Camping Maltatal
description:
Very big and good camp near Main Road.

This family campsite, hotel and restaurant has been run by the Pirker Family for more than 50 years - in other words, this is a real family business.

Maltatal is ab beautiful valley located between the national parks "Hohe Tauern" and "Nockberge" in the southernmost province of Austria - in Carinthia. It is also called the valley of the cascading water - the reason for this special name is the variety of waterfalls. One of the highest waterfalls in Carinthia named Fallbach is one of Malta's treasures.

Malta is a natural paradise - especially for hikers and mountain climbers. The valley offers you a huge variety of outdoor activities, as for example a leisurely hike with your family to our local mountain named Maltaberg.

Terrassencamping and Hotel Maltatal lies in a panoramic setting in the heart of the Malta Valley at an elevation of 800 metres above sea level.

This family campsite, hotel and restaurant has been run by the Pirker Family for more than 50 years - in other words, this is a real family business.

name: parking castle Trautenfels
description:
This is the parking of castle Trautenfels. You can stay here for a night. Nothing around besides a few trees and the castle.

People who park here are usually visitors of the castle or hikers. Hikers who will climb peak Grimming will come and park their cars between 05:00h - 08:00h.

There is an established campground nearby at the Putterersee near Aigen.

name: Schloß Rosenburg
description: Parking lot next to adventure park. Quiet and comfortable.

name: Parking Overnight next to Police Station
description:
CAUTION!!! In whole Bregenz it is not allowed to park resp. stay overnight outside camping place, you will get a ticket.
Except at this slot but only small campers.
4,30 € for whole day

name: Sonnencamping Stubai
description:
Nice Campground next to a big Spa. Facilities are on a high level.

+43 5225 64042

Landesstraße 3
6165 Telfes im Stubai
Österreich

name: Campingplatz Judenstein
description:
Nice camp in the mountain village near Innsbruck. Clean toilets, shower for free. 
21,50€ for 2 adults sleeping in the car. 
At 8:00 comes the baker with the foodtruck.

name: Schiltern,  Kittenberger Erlebnisgärten
description:
Translation: 2 parking spaces with electricity and space for additional mobile homes on the parking lot
2 Stellplätze mit Strom und auf den Parkplätzen Platz für weitere Wohnmobil.

name: Riverside Spot
description: nice flat area behind the irish pub. few places to pull in with nice views and quiet at night. we stayed a few nights with no issue.

name: Kaoo restaurant
description:
A really nice place to eat vegetarian Asian food.
The dishes are delicious and very tasty. The terrace is beautiful and cosy, which ad a lovely touch to the environment.
The staff are really kind and helpful.
We highly recommend it

name: Apartment „Mühlviertel“
description:
Big Apartment 120 qm, 3 sleeping room 
Garage,

name: Camping Hochkrimml
description:
€43 p/n campsite (1 camper, 2 ppl) with amazing view and 20m walk to the piste. Price includes shower, toilet, grey and black water dump, washing machine and dryer. Very clean and friendly employees.

You should check-in at the restaurant 'Plattenalm'.

name: Near hongarie boarder
description: Wild site at 5 kms off Burg village .quite area

name: Camping Familie Steindl
description:
Camping on the Danube, located at the end of a road there is only one cycle path further. Large vehicles possible. Meadow slightly sloping. Restaurant on site.
.....
Camping an der Donau, am Ende einer Straße gelegen es führt nur ein Radweg weiter. Große Fahrzeuge möglich. Wiese leicht abschüssig. Restaurant vor Ort.

name: Camp 7
description:
a new Place for Motorhomes that start in the next Time. we stand Overnight with the ok of the owner.
it is Close to the street with a wall betwen place and street. 
a big Sign Show the Place.

name: Wetterschutzhütte
description: A small hut for storms. Its always open and there is a small water tank for emergency. Its at the beginning of an golf club so be aware of flying golfballs ;)

name: Mösern Toilette und wasser
description: A small fountain eith portablr water and on the other side of the road there is an open toilett

name: Picknickbank
description: A fountain with portable water and a picknickbench

name: Jakobsbrunnen 1977
description: a fountain with potable water on the Jakobsweg

name: Mötz brunnen
description: A fountain with potable water next to the "Bürgerzentrum" in Mötz

name: Parking Place ‚Alten Rhein‘
description:
Large gravel parking, close to the Rhine River and a small Restaurant / Beergarden, offering nice and basic dinners and toilets. The parking place is an official motorhome overnight Spot and free of charge from 20:00 until 8:00. The beergarden owners approved of spending the night at the parking. 

Nice and quiet, away from any street noice. Seems that during the day, this is a starting point for walks along the Rhine river.

name: Near river
description: A spot near a lake. Not crowded. For car, van, mobilhome but also enough grass for a tent. Great spot!

name: Parkplatz Traunsee Ost
description:
Parking close to lake, beach volleyball and many restaurants. Have to pay 8€ between 9-17. Overnight is free. Maximum is 72h 

Bathroom is closed overnight. 

Water right outside the gate in front of the fire station “Freiwillige Feuerwehr”. Also check out on google maps, there are many water fountains around the town that are delicious to drink from (as to be expected in the alps)

name: Lavamund football park
description:
Neat to the small Lavamund marina, football club and a camping.
Free parking, kids games and water.
No signs forbidding camping, so... 
Calm, road not so far away but calm at night. Nice view of trees and water. 
.....
Juste à côté du terrain de foot, d'un petit port et d'un camping. Parking gratuit, jeux pour enfants et eau potable.
Pas de panneaux interdisant de camper.
Plutôt calme, route pas tres loin.

name: panorama camping sonnenberg
description:
very beautiful and quit camping with an amazing view. the facilities are super clean and included in the price.
more information on theire website

name: Linz AG Drinkwater
description: Official water from LinzAG Water with sign Drinkwater

name: FC Oberndorf Parking Lot
description:
There is a parking Lot next to the Football field. 
nice few at the "Wilder Kaiser". 
Others will be staying there for 1 night, too.

Keep it Clean!

name: Riverbed Wild Camping
description: Just a little turnoff right next to the street and the river. You have to drive through a couple meters of mud, but it was pretty dry, when we were there. If it’s not as dry, you may need 4wd. Perfect spot for a camper. No big rigs.

name: Camping Leifling
description: Very nice and cheap campground with very clean toilet, shower and a nice view... Everything you need!

name: Parking near Villach
description: Small isolated parking very nice for one night or more. There is even a garbage can to throw away your waste. Don't be afraid to be near the highway, it's very quiet at night there is a few walkers and athletes in the morning on the bike path.

name: Ybbs river
description:
Very easy access. This place is a local picnic area so during weekends might get crowded. Therefore we think it is acceptable to spend a night or two here - as some locals did that.

There is a nice, stony beach at river bank. ;)

If you go further down the road there should be a more quiet spot. But there is no-entry sign. :(

name: Forest parking by the creek
description:
A few parking spots by a gravel road just before no-entry sign. During weekends parking fills up quickly in the morning hours. So because of the cars, no more than individual spaces should be used as parking spaces. The driveway seems narrow and a little bit steep but in reality is short and fine.

Even with some houses close by it is very quiet and peaceful place. So pay respect for locals to keep this place open for overlanders. ;)

Forest and creek gives great chill during hit summer.

name: Pürgg
description: Nice Place, only for 3 Campers also for havy Trucks.

name: Rax Park'n Camp
description:
Campsite next to the Hollental river and close to the cable car.
Just above the road.
You have all the amenities

name: Obertilliach Langlaufzentrum
description:
Nice campground near a creek. Checking-in with a QR-Code is very simple.
There are two campgrounds, one on the parking lot and one near the creek on greasy land.
I paid EUR 10.00 for 1 Camper, and one person

name: Nice place
description: Very nice place, but private. Owner is friendly, please keep it super clean!

name: Riverside
description:
Very nice place, quiet, Grassy, perfect for tents. 
This spot is clean, so please let it stay this way.

name: Kritzendorf RV parking & Services
description: The town has allotted a number of spaces for motorhomes.  The place is free and the services include fresh water (you need your own hose), cassette dumping with rinse water, grey dumping and rubbish bins.  No bathrooms or showers.  Very well lit. 4G cell reception.  It's right by the train station; PRO: you can catch a train right to Vienna!  CON: you hear the trains at night.

name: Forststraße/Dead End
description: Little gravel plateau near the road. Silent with a great view.

name: Riverside
description:
Level pitch right on the river Shady and quiet. no service
---
Ebener Stellplatz direkt am Fluss Schattig und ruhig. Kein Service

name: Obergründbichlgut
description: Beautiful farm location - 6 level sites with water and power, with a beautiful view of the Alps and the valley below. Good cell phone reception… slightly narrow road getting to the location, but should be good for all but the largest vehicles.

name: Calm parking near park and river
description: A quiet and dark (no lanterns) parking to sleep in a car. Rather not for a tent, unless you find a secret spot in the trees. There’s river nearby (very clean) and a restaurant, if you need a civilized WC.

name: Schauphof
description: An overnight stay for campers near a good restaurant. It's a beautiful place, the parking is level, the view stunning. The parking space belongs to a restaurant.  The charge 10euros a night. Electra is extra. Very friendly owner, an a good small old fashioned restaurant. You'll share your table with others. Toilet available

name: Attersee (parking lot 152)
description: A beautiful and quiet place to stay one day. It is in front of the Attersee lake and there are a nice view to the montains. WC 150m, Pizzaria 200m, Supermarket 200m.

name: Halt 4 Pension
description: A nice, clean & quiet guesthouse at Halt. EUR30 for a single room with attached toilet & shower. There is a TV, small table, fridge & heater in the room. Breakfast is available for EUR5.

name: parking overnight
description: Nice parking lot near hiking trails, very suitable for staying overnight. Overnight stays are expressly allowed. Free toilets available on site.

name: camping katzinger
description: Small campsite in a beautiful location with a wide view of the mountains. If you are looking for peace and quiet, this is the right place. 2 people in the motorhome with electricity 14 euros. The next restaurant is 1.5 km away. Breakfast service is available.

name: Parkplatz Wildermieming
description:
Very silent nature parking lot. Only water facility after a very nice walk. 

Spot can also be found via Google maps: Parkplatz Wildermieming, 6413 Wildermieming, Oostenrijk. 

We were there during high season and were the only ones. In the photos we also included the view wham driving of the parking.

name: Long term parking lot
description: Difficult to find lot which says that it’s paid parking but has an open gate and the ticket machine says free. There were about 5 other campers parked here for what seems to be semi-permanent. We stayed for two night with no problems and no noise. Super close to the bus stop and KitzSki. No sign restricting overnight parking, either.

name: Service/Old road
description: On the road to Seeberg Sattle, on the outer curve of one of the serpentine bends, there is an old, perhaps service road. There is no view and the noise of the cars is not heard. Tent camping only.

name: Campinng Gippelblick Kernof
description: Formal site with spots for tents, cars, caravans. Beautiful view of the mountains. Clean facilities with shower/toilets/washing up area. Really nice owner. 10/10 recommend!!!

name: Traditionswerkstatt Edgar Eichwalder
description: Mechanic for electric bikes, scooters, and motorcycles. He doesn’t have official parts but is really creative and could probably find a solution to most problems! He solved our motorcycle’s broken clutch lever with some extra welding and screws. Really friendly too!

name: Camping Ausee
description:
Large camp site at the shore of a lake. Beautiful! Toilets, showers and dish washing facilities very clean.
We where here off season. No tourists at all.

name: Donaupark Camping Tulln
description: Vast camping at the danube shore. 1.5 km to town center. Very nice staff. Close to swimming pond. Very quiet.

name: Riverside
description:
Rather big spot near the river and not visible from the road. The place is very big. The ground is gravel and very flat. The spot is accessible via a gravel road, but no 4x4 is needed.
When you leave the tarmac road, follow the river, until you arrive at the place. There is a walking path nearby, but all peoples where friendly.

name: Seecamping Krumau
description: Idyllically situated campground with small Restaurant

name: Camping@LisiGrün
description: The small camping space is on our farm in upper Austria and located close to the center of the village Sattledt. The farm flowers and vegetables are grown organically. The camping space is next to Lisi Grüns’ garden and our "garden kitchen", our space for workshops and events. There you find a kitchen and a compost toilet.

name: Fritz Camping
description: Small open grassy field close to village. Very peaceful and nice walks. 6€ per person.

name: St. Nikolai Wanderparkplatz
description: Big gravel parking area at the entrance of the small village of St. Nikolai. A bit uneven, some small trees. Walking and hiking trails close by. You can hear the cars passing by from the Sölkpassstrasse, but there is almost no traffic at night time. Free parking, garbage can. No facilities.

name: Soboth Stellplatz
description: Beautiful place to camp at the shore of Lake Soboth. Space for approx. 10 Campers. 15 euros for 24 hours, water, chemical toilet disposal, solar outdoor showers, toilets, access to the lake, swimming possible, restaurant during summer season. Beautiful grassy spots, tranquil at night No Grey water disposal or electricity

name: Taiskirchen
description: Just an overlander stop over for a night. There is a open shelter with table.

name: Pitch guarded by Jesus himself
description: This tiny spot is just next to a bench (and a cherry tree!) and Wayside cross in front of a field and just off a farm track. There is only room for one tent and one car, so no big rigs. I parked my car a bit further in the entrance to a field and the farmer came in the early morning, but was really friendly and didn't mind me camping here over night with my dog. You can Cleary hear the highway unfortunately but with earplugs I slept like a baby :) very peaceful pretty spot nonetheless. No water unfortunately, but wooden Bench.

name: Rechnitz lake and campsite
description:
Small camping ground connected to the local lake. Four spots for campers, plenty for tents.  Clean toilets and showers, small kitchen with fridge.

Price for 2 people in a tent was 22 Euro including the entrance for the lake. Fair price for Burgenland what we saw so far.

Restaurants are next to the lake and open according to the official opening times.

name: Villach, 2 Taborstrasse
description: Nice place in the forest, flat ground, no service.

name: Pöstlingbergbahn
description:
Parking for a view spot and starting point for hikes for people. The parking lot itself is in a slight slope (but manageable with blocks or even without). Tones of space for vehicles of any size. There is a bus parking area as well. No signs posted for overnight restrictions. Wake up to a view over the city and the pre-alps, what could be more asked for…?

Oh yeah and the tram stop is within a 5min walking distance bringing you to the old town within 25min, parking is free during the day as well.

name: Mondale
description: Grass area next to the town (easy walk) and close to the lake (less than 5 mins).   The car park next to the grass area has a clean public toilet.  The Carpark is paid, where the grass area is free.   A few people seem to camp here overnight with no problem

name: Viewpoint parking in Grossalm Straße
description: Little pull out on the side of a road with tree clearing that gives gorgeous views on the lakes, free parking, no restrictions posted. When we pulled in 2 other campers were parked here. During the day, the road gets somewhat busy but calms down during the night. Entire lot is on a slight slope but manageable. Benches as well. Only downside no bathrooms accessories but forest can be accessed. No walking to town unless on the road which seems a bit dangerous but it’s not too far on it.

name: Last free parking spot before Hallstatt
description:
There are at least 4-5 pull outs  on the way between Steeg and Hallstatt, some of which have bathrooms, others don’t. All are good for one night and don’t have signs posting otherwise. So you’ll definitely find your free spot on this lake.  

This specific one, has no amenities and is very close to the road (literally just a pull out) on the plus side it does have a nice view and is within walking distance of the town (though it is along side the busy road). It probably fits up to 6-8 cars or smaller campers/vans. I’d say bigger rigs are probably better off in some of the spots along the way before.

Road is gets quieter after 9-10pm

name: Town center Stobl
description:
Nice little parking lot tucked away behind and old empty apartment building. No signs prohibiting overnight stay and space for at least 8-10 campers. There were 3 others here overnight with us on a Monday night. Quiet little town to visit next day. Very level ground

Though this lake is much more developed compared to some of the others in the region, seems more family oriented with water ski school, and other fun stuff to do right from the town center. 

Toilets are in the main square (5min walk) as well as a water fountain.

name: Water fountain
description: public water fountain suitable for filling up water bottles

name: Water fountain in the centre of Klagenfurt
description:
Tap dispensing drinking water on the street. very fast flowing, suitable for filling large bottles.
opposite a set of (free, wheelchair-accessible) toilets, near the bus stop

name: Wild camp near river
description: Quiet spot near quarry. Perfect for one night. A steep drive up a dirt road. People drove by and didn't mind.

name: camping Grubenbauer
description:
super idyllic campground for campervans, tents, big rigs. if you want to get away from the super busy, hyper touristy places - this is your spot. lovely family business, super clean bathrooms, amazing views and peace and quiet.

1person with tent and bicycle 15€ in high season.

name: Garnitzenklamm P1
description:
Official Garnitzenklamm car park.
Top left of the entrance.
Quiet and a bit isolated.

name: Camping Bad Schallerbach
description:
RV park Bad Schallerbach
Paid parking space for 7 mobile on the outskirts of Bad Schallerbach. The pitch is located at a sports venue. Mostly flat, sunny place. Subsoil partly from meadow and gravel. Center can be reached on foot 300m. Serviced on site: Barrier-free, Dogs allowed, Electricity, WC, Shower. Activities in the area: playground, spa / health resort in 250m, designated hiking trails, designated bike paths. Included in the price: Water, Disposal greywater, Disposal chemical WC. 
PS: drinks in the evening in the sports home
PS: is on a railway line = loud!
Open April till end october. 
Dogs allowed , WiFi

name: Campingplatz Melk
description: Small campsite, relatively basic, space for both vehicles, and cyclists with tents, limited shade, grassy pitches, some picnic tables. friendly owners. reception closes early, but it's ok to arrive in the evening and pay in the morning. I paid 10€/night for 1 person, small tent and bicycle.

name: Wolayer Tal
description: Turn off from the B111 near Birnbaum into the unpaved road to Wolayer See. The road ist steep, narrow and winding. OK for small 4x4 or vans. Flat spot next to the Wolayer Bach.

name: Wanderparkplatz Landsberg
description: Nice view, quiet in the night. In the evening locals come for running, walking, hiking to the Landsberg mountain. No comments/complains. The little road is tared nearly to the end.

name: Near Prutz
description: Grill area where you probably can camp, no forbidden sign, also next to it there is the river and other cool spots to pitch a tent

name: Glanzer Landrover Mechanics
description: Very competent car mechanics - specialized in Landrover Defender (also older models). The friendly owner, Wolfgang Glanzer, is very committed and helpful.

name: Klettergarten
description: Little shelter with table and benches, toilet behind the shelter, next to a rock climbing area. Only for people by foot or bicycles. Campervans are not allowed.

name: Playground
description: Playground right next to a bicycle path. A village is nearby but we didn't see anyone in the evening and night. Potable water and a shelter. We slept on the big tables under the shelter and there is enough space for a tent.

name: Festplatz Purbach
description: Place for 5 Campers. No height restriction. Free! Freshwater, Dump Station and free SolarEnergy from 7:30AM-5:30PM (16Amp). Very quiet. Volleyball field nearby. Little swim lake opposite.

name: Water
description: Village fountain with cold, tasty drinking water. Parking possible.

name: Camping Linz-Pichlingersee
description:
Big and clean sanitary facilitis, hot free showers, friendly welcome.
There is all what you neet for the campcar.
But it is not quiet aboud the highway!

name: Camping Seebauer
description: The view of the small lake and the mountains is nice but you pay 44,50 € for 2 persons and a camp car and there are only 2 toilets and showers. You pay for the shower 0,50 € for 3 minutes and dishwashing the same. At night it is quiet, in the day, there are a lot of day visitors. There are dumping stations at every site, but you need extra hose. You coudn't drive over there.

name: Parking place "Sattele"
description: Nice place to sleep. The parking fee for one day is €4.00. Very quiet at night.

name: Shelter
description: A shelter with benches and tables next to a lake. You are not allowed to swim into the lake because it's a reservoir. Locals came by and greeted us friendly. No one seemed to be bothered. We had a quiet night. We slept on the tables. You can also set up your inner tent in the shelter.

name: Shelter next to the river
description: It's a small shelter next to the river Salzach and directly at the cycle path "Tauernradweg". There are benches and a table inside. We set up our inner tent inside the shelter and there is enough space around for another tent.

name: Parking Spot over Jerzens
description: A place to sleep overnight in a small camper/car. Nice hikes near by. The spot is near some holiday homes and a hotel with a restaurant and sauna (7€ to use. Nice.) There was some traffic, but the locals didn't seem to mind us sleeping here. There is a water spring 5 min walking north of the site. Spent 2 nights without issue.

name: Reisepotpourri
description: We are an Austrian couple. We travelled one year and we experienced a lot of hospitality during our travel journey. For overnight, help or support, please contact us. 00436803059354 (Pierre & Bernadette)

name: Vienna Hostel Ruthensteiner
description:
really nice hostel , parking outside free for motorbikes , very safe . i stayed for 12 days .
no problem!  the hostel have kitchen , food for the night ( 5€ tip ) and nice staff

name: Ideal Camping Lampele
description: it is a beautiful Campsite. It is directly at the Ossiacher See.
